creditline: Gift of James F. and Louise H. Bell
inscription:
Mark

- On the front, the later arsm (about 1750) of Bethell impaling Alwyn.  On the cover, the crest of Bethell.  On the underside of the base:      [B]
                                                                                          [G] [*] [A]
And a later set of initials:  [H * R * M]
markings:
Mark

- Fully marked (Britannia standard) on upper side of cover. Fully marked on side of body near handle.  Maker\'s mark on lower portion of handle.  Maker\'s mark, Britannia, and lion\'s head on bezel of lid.
text: The design of this tankard is a fashionable form made in England and America during the late 17th and early 18th centuries.  This example is handsomely decorated with a familial coat of arms.
title: Tankard
